member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl.EnsureValid(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make this UITestControl valid if this has become invalid.
member.param: If true then it will call WaitForReady() on the element.
Refetch the control if not available
member.remarks: We dont need WaitForReady() to be called in EnsureValid if next call(e.g. Click, DoubleClick etc) goes through playback engine. The playback engine takes care if the element is not ready. If we call WaitForReady() in such cases it will cause little perf hit. For other cases like GetProperty()/SetProperty() we directly call on IAfxElement so we need WaitForReady() to be called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl.WaitForControlReady
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the control is ready to accept mouse/keyboard input, or until the timeout specified by PlaybackSettings.WaitForReadyTimeout expires.
member.returns: True if the control is ready, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl.WaitForControlReady(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the control is ready to accept mouse/keyboard input, or the specified timeout expires.
member.param: The maximum number of milliseconds to wait, or System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
member.returns: True if the control is ready, false otherwise.
member.remarks: When the wait operation results in an implicit search for the control or, when the application is busy, the actual wait time could be more than the timeout specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl.WaitForControlEnabled
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the control is enabled, or until the timeout specified by PlaybackSettings.WaitForReadyTimeout expires.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Keyboard.SendKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Sends the keystrokes to generate the specified text.
member.param: Text to generate.
member.remarks: The text may contain modifier key info. The modifiers keys are - ^ ControlKey + ShiftKey % AltKey # WinKey If any characters representing modifiers keys are to be sent then it should be enclosed in braces like {+}. And to send braces, enclose it in barces like {{} and {}}
member.example: SendKeys("^a"). This will send Control+a to TestControl.

member.example: SendKeys("^a"). This will send Control+a to TestControl.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times a retry can be done for a single action via PlaybackError handler in a coded ui test.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.PlaybackSettings.MatchExactHierarchy
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to match exact hierarchy specified for searching this control. Each control is specified as a hierarchy of containing controls for the search. If this flag is set to true, all ancestors of the control will be searched in order to locate this control. If this flag is set to false, some of the ancestors may be skipped during the search. For example, if the hierarchy of a control is A;B;C;D if A is found but playback fails to find full hierarchy B->C->D under it, then directly search for D under A if this property is set to false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Playback.CaptureScreenShot(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl)
member.summary: Captures desktop screen shot and highlights bounds of control; if bounds cannot be obtained for the control, its container is tried. - Highlights in red if bounds for current controls are found, to indicate that the last operation on this control is failed. - Highlights container bounds in green to indicate that search for a particular control within the container is failed. It also resets the TakeNextFailureScreenShot flag so that this method will not create infinite loop due the exceptions occuring within this method itself.
member.param: control on which a failure has occurred

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Playback.HandleExceptionAndRetry(System.Exception,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method determines if the input exception is a playback related exception. If it is then it raises the PlaybackError event and returns whatever PlaybackErrorOption was set to the EventArgs Result field.
member.param: If this is false, the playback error handler won't be called.
member.returns: PlaybackErrorOptions.Default if exception wasn't handled. Else whatever was chosen in handler

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Playback.TakeNextFailureScreenShot
member.summary:
Whether screen shot of desktop needs to be taken on next exception. If this flag is set, when a next exception occurs, a snap shot is taken, and the bounds of the corresponding failed control is highlighted in red. If search for corresponding control is failed, its container's bounds are highlighted instead in green.
Use LastFailureScreenShot property to retrieve the screen shot.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Playback.LastFailureScreenShot
member.summary: Screen shot taken at the time of last exception. If TakeNextFailureScreenShot is set, this will retrieve screen shot of last failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ActionLogFormatter.GetAncestorInformation(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl,System.String@)
member.summary: If no friendly name is found on the element for a particular action, element's ancestor is searched for a better friendly name. This method returns the newly generated friendly name which gives the position of the element in its ancestor along with the ancestor's information
member.param: The given dot separated UI Object Name.
The UI Map. This is needed to get the ancestor of an object.
The returned value of friendly type name of the ancestor.
member.returns: The friendly type name of the ancestor.
member.remarks: Strangely, when the UI object is deserialized from an XML file, the ancestor information for UI Object is not filled. Therefore we cannot rely on uiObject.Ancestor. That is the reason we pass around UIMap.

member.summary: Gets the friendly name of a control
member.param: control under consideration
the controls type
whether or not to consider desktop element if control is null
member.remarks: If the control is not found we get friendly name from queryid. Any exceptions thrown as a result of getting friendly name are supressed so that the corresponding warning and error messages are logged properly.
